availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel S. Adams (Carter County, Kentucky, iron furnace worker and pvt 7th and 22nd Ky Inf)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, iron furnace worker and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Pleasant Adams and Eleanor Adams. Married to Nancy J. Adams. Father of Marion Adams and Oscar Adams. Resident of Carter County in 1850. Iron furnace worker in Carter County in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as corporal and private from December 12, 1861. Reported as deserted on January 21, 1863. Sentenced by court martial and transferred to the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.), serving as private to February 27, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 270A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 276.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, District 3, p. 32A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0209.
Find A Grave, "Daniel S. Adams (1836-unknown)," Memorial #111528861, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111528861 (accessed September 24, 2020).
